clinical_study.brief_title: Umbilical Cord Mesenchymal Stem Cells Infusion Via Hepatic Artery in Cirrhosis Patients
clinical_study.official_title: The Safety and Efficacy of Umbilical Cord Mesenchymal Stem Cells Infusion Via Hepatic Artery in Cirrhosis Patients.

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to investigate the efficacy of umbilical cord mesenchymal stem cells (MSCs) infusion via hepatic artery in the treatment of liver cirrhosis.

detailed_description.textblock: To investigate the efficacy of umbilical cord mesenchymal stem cells (MSCs) infusion via hepatic artery in the treatment of liver cirrhosis. Patients with liver cirrhosis were randomly separated into two groups. Umbilical cord MSCs were infused to patients using interventional method via hepatic artery for One group. After the catheter placed at proper hepatic artery was confirmed by angiography, umbilical cord MSCs were infused slowly for 15-20minutes. The control group accepted conserved therapy.

primary_outcome.measure: The result of liver function and liver histological improvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: The disappearance or reduction of abdominal dropsy
The clinical symptom improve(including food appetite,debilitation,abdominal distension,edema of lower limbs )

arm_group.description: Umbilical cord mesenchymal stem cells were infused to patients using interventional method via hepatic artery. After the catheter placed at proper hepatic artery was confirmed by angiography,umbilical cord MSCs were infused slowly for 15-20minutes.
Patients received comprehensive treatment including antiviral drugs, lowering aminotransferase and jaundice medicine.

intervention.description: Umbilical cord mesenchymal stem cells were infused to patients using interventional method via hepatic artery. After the catheter placed at proper hepatic artery was confirmed by angiography,umbilical cord MSCs were infused slowly for 15-20minutes.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Aged 18~70 years.
- Liver cirrhosis
- written consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- The end-stage of liver cirrhosis.
- Severe problems in other vital organs(e.g.the heart,renal or lungs).
- Hepatocellular carcinoma or other malignancies
- Pregnancy
- sepsis
- Presence of significant extrahepatic biliary disease (e.g. CBD stone, PSC, etc.)
- Cardiac, renal or respiratory failure
- Active thrombosis of the portal or hepatic veins
